title: Pick Intent being shown to enemy team when it's your turn to pick feels not right
body:
Right now if you select a pick intent, it's shown as your pick of choice when it's your turn to select a champion.

If you want to change your pick because (1) it doesn't fit what your opponents have already picked, (2) you want to swap with one of your allies, your enemies can either (1) see that you're not in your comfort zone or (2) see what you wish to get picked by the other swapper. 

Of course one can avoid the aforementioned issues by not using the pick intent, but that defeats the very meaning of the feature and feels like a poor solution.

It is not gamebreaking, but it's an unnecessary leak of information that could be easily avoided, like having your pick intent be a "hidden" pick that you can instantly lock-in but that your opponents can't see unless you either lock it or select it while "zapping" through champions.

The issue is as follows:

- You are second to pick. Your pick intent champion was "Veigar". Your opponents have locked in "Lucian".

When it comes your turn to pick, the enemy team *immediately* sees Veigar in your champ select. They now know you are *very likely* the mid laner, and that your pick intent is Veigar.

If you then swap to Annie, this communicates to the enemy team you are worried about blind picking mid lane and picked a safety pick (therefore, you are not confident).

If you swap to Leona, they know you want to play Veigar but are not confident to blind pick him, and thus are swapping with the support. They can respond by picking Zed, for example, who usually wins lane against Veigar.

BEFORE,

The enemy would see nothing except you picking Annie or Leona immediately. They have no idea whether you safety or confidently picked Annie, and they have no idea you might have wanted to play Veigar mid.


When you know lane matchups, it's an advantage to know pick intent for your opponents.

If you are using a safety pick you are not confident in then you aren't using a safety pick.

I agree with the lane swap point though.

You're right, the point of a safety pick is a champ you can be confident in. :P I meant that you're on your backup and not main and they'd know that. So you're not on your best champion, something like that?
